brief_summary.textblock:
An Open Label, Pilot Study Testing the Safety and Efficacy of Inhaled Treprostinil (Tyvaso®)
      in the Treatment of Pulmonary Hypertension (PH) Associated with Chronic Obstructive
      Pulmonary Disease (COPD)

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Pulmonary Hypertension Associated COPD With Inhaled Treprostinil-1

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a pilot study of 10 patients that have COPD-PH. Primary outcome measure is to see if
      this drug is safe for this patient population and the secondary measure is to see if the
      drug improves patient functional capacity.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: must have:

          -  be between the ages of 30 and 80

          -  have a clinical diagnosis of Gold stage 2 to 4 COPD

          -  have a diagnosis of pulmonary hypertension established by a historic  right heart
             catheterization

          -  a minimum weight of 45 Kg

          -  minimum systolic blood pressure of >90 mmHg

          -  be able to perform a six minute walk test

          -  be able to maintain a oxygen saturation >88% at rest (with or without oxygen)

          -  be treated with background therapy for COPD for a minimum of 1 month prior to
             consideration of enrollment.

          -  be competent to understand the information given in the Institutional Review Board
             (IRB) or Independent Ethics Committee (IEC) approved Informed Consent Form and must
             sign the form prior to the initiation of any study procedure.

        Exclusion Criteria. Cannot have or be:

          -  The presence of pulmonary venous hypertension defined by a historical right heart
             catheterization

          -  Gold Stage I COPD

          -  documented left ventricular dysfunction as measured by echocardiography

          -  pregnant or breastfeeding

          -  Recipient of a lung transplant

          -  received chronic prostanoid therapy for pulmonary hypertension within 4 weeks prior
             to the screening appointment

          -  A requirement of greater than 9 l/min of O2 to maintain oxygen saturations greater
             than 88% at rest

          -  No other serious medical conditions

clinical_study.official_title: TAPIT-1: Treatment of Pulmonary Hypertension Associated COPD With Inhaled Treprostinil-1

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: A 4-Week, Open Label Study Testing the Safety of Inhaled Treprostinil (Tyvaso®) in the Treatment of Pulmonary Hypertension (PH) Associated with Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease (COPD) (PH-COPD)
primary_outcome.measure: To assess the safety of Tyvaso ® as assessed by changes or stability of acute oxygenation (pulse oximetry) and spirometry (FEV1).

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: A change in functional class is assessed as improvement or deterioration in the patient's functional status
secondary_outcome.measure: New York Heart Association (NYHA) functional class
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in New York Heart Association (NYHA) functional class assessed at baseline and at week 4.

secondary_outcome.description: A change in how far the subject can walk in 6 minutes will be measured at baseline and compared to how far the subject can walk in 6 minutes at week 4.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline in 6 minute walk distance at 4 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Clinical worsening is described as Death, hospitalization (all cause)and COPD exacerbations (worsening of respiratory symptoms which require treatment with oral corticosteroids, antibiotics or both).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of randomization to until the subject discontinues from study for any cause, assessed up to 4 weeks

secondary_outcome.description:
The phagocytic index is the average number of bacteria ingested per phagocyte in an incubated mixture of bacteria, phagocytes, and blood serum. We will also be looking a a change in gene expression of these (PBMC) cells.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
secondary_outcome.measure: Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells (PBMC) phagocytic index (PI) and PBMC gene expression
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline in PBMC PI and PBMC gene expression at 4 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: The St. George's questionnaire is a quality of life questionnaire completed by the subject at baseline and at week 4.
secondary_outcome.measure: St. George's Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in the St. George's respiratory questionnaire at 4 weeks

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
